title: Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil
snippet: Fabio Giglietto presented collaborative research with Dr. Giada Marino and Bruna Paroni that explores an innovative approach to analyzing political discourse: using fine-tuned large language models (LLMs) to examine political talk in hyperpartisan Facebook groups at the International Seminar on Disinformation, Social Media, and Climate in Porto Alegre, Brazil. He also presented a study with Giada Marino, Anwesha Chakraborty, Massimo Terenzi, and Samuel Olaniran on how deceptive operations evolve through cycles of trial and adaptation, which is based on research conducted through VERAAI_ALERTS.
description: The article discusses Fabio Giglietto's presentations at conferences in Brazil, where he presented research on disinformation and digital manipulation, including using LLMs to analyze political discourse in Facebook groups and the evolution of deceptive operations.

title: Mapping Italian News Research Program - Uniurb
snippet: Fabio Giglietto co-authored a white paper with Massimo Terenzi from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, which explores how the Digital Services Act (DSA) is transforming data access for platform research. The white paper focuses on the implementation of Article 40.12, which mandates Very Large Online Platforms (VLOPs) to provide access to “publicly available data”.
description: This news article from Uniurb discusses a white paper co-authored by Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi on the transformation of data access for platform research under the Digital Services Act.

title: In the Shadows of Disinformation: Fake News and Violations of Human Rights - ResearchGate
snippet: This ResearchGate report from December 15, 2023, references Fabio Giglietto et al.'s definition of disinformation as deliberately false information with the intent to deceive.
description: This ResearchGate publication from December 2023 analyzes disinformation and human rights, referencing Fabio Giglietto et al.'s definition of disinformation, indicating his research is being used and recognized in the field.

Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: This article introduces the team at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo working on the vera.ai project, which includes Fabio Giglietto as the team leader. The team coordinates Work Package 4 (WP4) within the vera.ai project, focusing on discovering potentially problematic content in near-real-time using a content-agnostic approach, specifically addressing coordinated sharing behavior.
description: This article introduces the University of Urbino Carlo Bo team working on the vera.ai project, led by Fabio Giglietto, and their focus on discovering problematic content in near-real-time, addressing coordinated sharing behavior.
